topic.title: Deploy fails with - msdos Disks Labels Do not Support Partition Names

p.note: This process only applies to Swift drives. It does not apply to the operating system or boot drive.

strow.stentry: If a disk drive allocated to Swift uses the MBR partition table type, the deploy process refuses to label and format the drive. This is to prevent potential data loss as explained in Requirements for a Disk Drive. If you intend to use the disk drive for Swift, you must convert the MBR partition table to GPT on the drive using /sbin/sgdisk.

You must install gdisk, before using sgdisk.
Execute the following command to install gdisk,sudo apt-get install gdisk
Convert to GPT partition type. This is an example for converting /dev/sdd to the GPT partition type.sudo sgdisk â€“g /dev/sdd
Reboot the node to take effect. You may then resume the deploy (repeat the playbook that reported the error).
